item.title: 美国服务业活动在 11 月份得到喘息
item.description: 美国服务业活动在近几个月大幅增长后，11 月份有所放缓，但仍高于第四季度经济稳健增长的水平。【原文：U.S. services sector activity slowed in November after posting big gains in recent months, but remained above levels consistent with solid economic growth in the fourth quarter.】

item.title: 加拿大 11 月服务业采购经理人指数升至 19 个月新高
item.description: S&P全球公司周三公布的加拿大服务业采购经理人指数（PMI）数据显示，由于企业增加了员工，加拿大服务业经济在11月份连续第二个月实现扩张，但新增工作受到抑制，而且美国关税的威胁可能会损害市场情绪。【原文：Canada's services economy expanded for a second straight month in November as firms added staff, but incoming new work was subdued and the threat of U.S. tariffs could yet hurt sentiment, S&P Global's Canada services PMI data showed on Wednesday.】

item.title: 道达尔能源以 16.5 亿美元收购德国可再生能源开发商 VSB
item.description: 法国石油巨头道达尔能源公司（TotalEnergies）周三表示，已同意以 15.7 亿欧元（16.5 亿美元）的价格从瑞士资产管理公司 Partners Group 收购德国可再生能源开发商 VSB 集团。【原文：French oil major TotalEnergies has agreed to purchase German renewable developer VSB Group for 1.57 billion euros ($1.65 billion) from Swiss asset manager Partners Group, it said Wednesday.】

item.title: 首席财务官称，Stellantis 董事会与 Tavares 在短期优先事项和对外关系上存在分歧
item.description: 财务总监道格-奥斯特曼（Doug Ostermann）周三表示，卡洛斯-塔瓦雷斯与斯泰兰特董事会成员之间的分歧导致了首席执行官的突然辞职，分歧主要集中在未来15个月的工作重点以及汽车制造商与利益相关者的关系上。【原文：Divergences between Carlos Tavares and Stellantis board members, which led to the CEO's abrupt resignation, were mainly over priorities for the next 15 months and on how the automaker relates to its stakeholders, finance chief Doug Ostermann said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 美联储穆萨勒姆预计将进一步降息，但称宽松路径不太清晰
item.description: 圣路易斯联储主席阿尔贝托-穆萨莱姆周三表示，他预计美国央行将能够继续降息，但他警告说，未来行动的步伐已经越来越不明确。【原文：St. Louis Federal Reserve President Alberto Musalem said on Wednesday he expects the U.S. central bank will be able to continue to cut interest rates but warned the pace of future actions has grown less clear.】

item.title: 西门子首席执行官布施的薪酬增长 26%，达到 861 万欧元
item.description: 德国工程公司西门子周三表示，西门子首席执行官罗兰-布施 2024 财年的薪酬总额增长了 26%，达到 861 万欧元（904 万美元）。【原文：Siemens Chief Executive Roland Busch's total compensation package rose 26% to 8.61 million euros ($9.04 million) for the 2024 financial year, the German engineering company said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 捷蓝航空预测 2024 年收入下滑幅度较小，因为国内旅行需求回升
item.description: 捷蓝航空公司（JetBlue Airways）周三表示，由于美国总统大选后国内旅游需求反弹，该公司预计 2024 年的收入降幅将小于预期。【原文：JetBlue Airways said on Wednesday it expects a smaller-than-expected drop in its 2024 revenue as domestic travel demand rebounded following the U.S. presidential election.】

item.title: 美国 11 月私营部门就业人数增幅略低于预期
item.description: 美国 ADP 全国就业报告》（ADP National Employment Report）周三显示，11 月份美国私营企业就业人数温和增长。【原文：U.S. private payrolls increased at a moderate pace in November, the ADP National Employment Report showed on Wednesday.】

item.title: Snoop Dogg 助阳狮集团夺得全球最大广告集团称号
item.description: 法国阳狮集团邀请在巴黎奥运会上一鸣惊人的美国说唱歌手史努比-道格（Snoop Dogg）为其助阵，庆祝其在 2024 年超越英国竞争对手 WPP 成为全球最大的广告集团。【原文：France's Publicis has enlisted Snoop Dogg, the American rapper who became a breakout star at the Paris Olympics, to help it celebrate overtaking British rival WPP as the world's largest ad group in 2024.】

item.title: Lululemon 销售低迷，后起品牌步步紧逼
item.description: Lululemon 面临着四年多来最慢的季度增长，它将不得不面对华尔街的质疑，即它是否在快速向其门店推出更时尚的款式以更好地与运动休闲新贵竞争方面取得了重大进展。【原文：Lululemon , facing its slowest quarterly growth in more than four years, will have to deal with Wall Street questions on whether it has made significant strides toward fast-tracking trendier styles to its stores to better compete with athleisure upstarts.】

item.title: 联合健康预测 2025 年医疗成本高于预期
item.description: 联合健康（UnitedHealth）周三预测 2025 年的医疗成本将高于华尔街预期，因为该公司预计政府支持的保险业务对医疗服务的高需求将持续存在。【原文：UnitedHealth on Wednesday forecast medical costs for 2025 above Wall Street expectations as it expects high demand for healthcare services in its government-backed insurance businesses to persist.】

item.title: 独家：消息人士称，"激进 "目标在斯特兰蒂斯推翻了塔瓦雷斯
item.description: 两位知情人士告诉路透社，一些董事会成员认为目标不切实际或具有破坏性，导致 Stellantis 首席执行官卡洛斯-塔瓦雷斯（Carlos Tavares）在获得董事会全力支持仅一个月后突然下台。【原文：Targets deemed unrealistic or destructive by some board members triggered the sudden fall of Stellantis CEO Carlos Tavares just a month after he received their full backing, two people with knowledge of the matter told Reuters.】

item.title: 欧盟监管机构调查英伟达硬件捆绑行为，同时审查 Run:ai 交易
item.description: 欧盟反垄断监管机构正在询问英伟达（Nvidia）的客户，他们在购买该公司的图形处理器（GPU）软件产品和硬件时是否获得了折扣，因为他们正在仔细审查英伟达以 7 亿美元竞购 Run:ai 的交易。【原文：EU antitrust regulators are asking Nvidia customers if they have been offered discounts to buy the company's graphics processing unit (GPU) software products together with its hardware as they scrutinise its $700 million bid for Run:ai.】

item.title: 最新人工智能工具将加速需求增长，Salesforce 跃居榜首
item.description: Salesforce 股价在周三的盘前交易中大涨 12.5%，此前这家客户关系管理软件制造商的季度销售额超过预期，并对其新推出的人工智能集成产品做出了乐观预测。【原文：Salesforce shares jumped 12.5% in premarket trading on Wednesday, after the customer relationship management software maker topped quarterly sales estimates and provided an upbeat forecast for its newly launched AI integrated products.】

item.title: 育碧终止 XDefiant 项目，关闭旧金山和大阪工作室
item.description: 法国最大的视频游戏制造商育碧公司周三表示，已决定停止开发其免费第一人称射击游戏《XDefiant》。【原文：France's largest video game maker Ubisoft has decided to discontinue development on XDefiant, its free-to-play first-person shooter title, it said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 联合信贷银行将为富裕客户提供 Blackstone 私募股权投资基金
item.description: 意大利联合信贷银行（UniCredit）周三表示，将扩大与 Blackstone 的合作关系，开始为其较富裕的客户提供私募股权投资基金，这是通常为专业投资者保留的资产类别。【原文：Italian bank UniCredit said on Wednesday it was widening its partnership with Blackstone to start offering its wealthier clients a private equity fund, an asset class normally reserved for professional investors.】

item.title: 贝莱德押注人工智能驱动股市反弹，但美国债务给 2025 年前景蒙上阴影
item.description: 贝莱德预计，明年人工智能热潮将继续提振美股，并支持更广泛的经济增长，不过美国政府债务水平的上升可能会威胁到其对2025年的乐观预测。【原文：BlackRock expects the artificial intelligence boom to continue to boost U.S. stocks next year and support economic growth more broadly, although rising U.S. government debt levels could threaten its upbeat 2025 forecasts.】

item.title: 财富管理业务强劲，加拿大国家银行利润上升
item.description: 加拿大国家银行周三公布，受助于财富管理部门的强劲表现，第四季度利润有所增长。【原文：National Bank of Canada reported a rise in fourth-quarter profit on Wednesday, helped by strong performance in its wealth management unit.】

item.title: 通用汽车将为中国业务支出 50 多亿美元
item.description: 通用汽车公司周三告诉股东，该公司将为其在中国的合资企业记录两项总额超过 50 亿美元的非现金费用，其中一项与业务重组有关，另一项则反映了其价值的降低。【原文：General Motors told shareholders on Wednesday that it would record two non-cash charges totaling more than $5 billion on its joint venture in China, one related to the restructuring of the operation and another reflecting its reduced value.】

item.title: Dollar Tree 销售额和利润超出预期，首席财务官将卸任
item.description: Dollar Tree 周三公布的第三季度利润和销售额超出市场预期，原因是有更多顾客在其折扣店购买包括杂货在内的非昂贵必需品，这使其股价在盘前交易中上涨了约 10%。【原文：Dollar Tree's third-quarter profit and sales beat market expectations on Wednesday, as more customers shopped at its discount stores for non-expensive essentials including groceries, sending its shares up about 10% in premarket trading.】

item.title: 大众汽车因电池过热问题在美国召回 4,600 多辆汽车
item.description: 美国国家公路交通安全管理局（National Highway Traffic Safety Administration）周三表示，大众汽车将在美国召回4616辆汽车，原因是担心这些汽车的高压电池可能会过热并增加起火风险。【原文：Volkswagen is recalling 4,616 vehicles in the United States over concerns that their high-voltage batteries may overheat and increase the risk of a fire, the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 独家报道Northvolt 寻求在年底前出售电动工业电池业务
item.description: 一份内部备忘录显示，由于缺乏资金，Northvolt 不得不在年底前剥离为数不多的盈利业务之一，因此该公司已与一家大型工业公司就出售为重工业生产电动电池组的业务进行了谈判。【原文：Northvolt has held talks with a big industrial company on selling the business that makes electric battery packs for heavy industry, as a lack of funds forces it to try to divest one of its few profitable operations by the year-end, an internal memo shows.】

item.title: 加拿大皇家银行（RBC）财富管理业绩强劲，季度利润上升
item.description: 加拿大皇家银行（Royal Bank of Canada）周三报告称，由于财富管理业务的强劲表现，这家加拿大最大的银行第四季度利润有所增长。【原文：Royal Bank of Canada reported a rise in fourth-quarter profit on Wednesday as the country's biggest lender benefited from strong performance in its wealth management business.】

item.title: 美国鲍威尔在韩国瓮中捉鳖，法国拭目以待
item.description: Mike Dolan 展望美国和全球市场的未来一天【原文：A look at the day ahead in U.S. and global markets from Mike Dolan】

item.title: 关注美联储评论和经济数据，期货价格上扬
item.description: 美国股指期货周三上涨，其中与 S&P 500 指数挂钩的股指期货创下历史新高，因为投资者关注即将公布的数据以及包括美国央行主席杰罗姆-鲍威尔在内的央行官员的评论。【原文：U.S. stock index futures rose on Wednesday, with those tied to the S&P 500 hitting all-time highs as investors focus on upcoming data and commentary from central bank officials including Chair Jerome Powell.】

item.title: 大众汽车首席执行官与工人发生冲突，因倒闭和薪酬问题矛盾加深
item.description: 大众汽车公司首席执行官和劳工老板在周三的员工会议上发生冲突，管理层力主大幅裁员，而工人们则警告说，只要工厂关闭仍是这家陷入困境的德国汽车制造商工资谈判的一部分，他们就会举行更多罢工。【原文：Volkswagen's CEO and labour boss clashed during a staff meeting on Wednesday, with management pushing for major cuts while workers warned of more strikes as long as plant closures remain part of wage negotiations at the embattled German automaker.】

item.title: 美国参议员抨击航空公司视乘客为 "行走的储蓄罐
item.description: 美国参议院一个小组的负责人严厉批评了航空公司不断上涨的行李费和座位分配费，称航空公司正在寻找从乘客身上榨取更多钱财的新方法。【原文：The head of a U.S. Senate panel harshly criticized rising airline fees for luggage and seat assignments, saying carriers are looking for new ways to extract more money from passengers.】

item.title: 英国采购经理人指数（PMI）显示，就业成本上升影响服务业增长
item.description: 周三的一项调查显示，由于雇主税即将增加，影响了企业的招聘计划，英国占主导地位的服务业在11月份失去了活力，尽管其幅度没有人们最初担心的那么大。【原文：Britain's dominant services sector lost steam in November, although not by as much as first feared, as a looming rise in employer taxes weighed on firms' hiring plans, a survey showed on Wednesday.】

item.title: 采购经理人指数显示欧元区 11 月商业活动大幅下滑
item.description: 一项调查显示，整个欧元区的商业活动在上个月急剧下降，因为该集团占主导地位的服务业与制造业一起出现萎缩。【原文：Business activity across the euro zone fell sharply last month as the bloc's dominant services sector joined the manufacturing sector in contracting, according to a survey which showed a broadbased decline.】

item.title: 调查显示德国企业对中国市场的信心降至历史最低点
item.description: 一个德国商业游说团体周三表示，在华德国企业的商业情绪正处于历史最低点，因为它们面临着日益激烈的中国竞争和不断放缓的经济。【原文：Business sentiment among German companies in China is at an all-time low, a German business lobby group said on Wednesday, as they face rising Chinese competition and a slowing economy.】
